objectives: Evaluate evidence and reasoning about digital journalism

multiple_intelligences.linguistic: Write a story or essay about digital journalism
multiple_intelligences.logical_mathematical: Analyze patterns and create logical arguments about digital journalism
multiple_intelligences.spatial: Create visual representations or mind maps of digital journalism
multiple_intelligences.bodily_kinesthetic: Role-play or act out scenarios related to digital journalism
multiple_intelligences.musical: Create a song or rhythm exercise about digital journalism
multiple_intelligences.interpersonal: Collaborate in groups to discuss digital journalism
multiple_intelligences.intrapersonal: Reflect individually on personal connection to digital journalism
multiple_intelligences.naturalistic: Categorize and classify concepts related to digital journalism

content.basic: Simplified texts and basic vocabulary about digital journalism
content.intermediate: Standard complexity materials with support about digital journalism
content.advanced: Complex authentic materials and academic texts about digital journalism

process.grouping: Individual, pairs, small groups, or whole class based on preference
process.choice: Multiple activity options aligned with learning style

differentiation.environment: Quiet space with good acoustics and audio equipment

warm_up.description: Students listen to audio about digital journalism and share reactions

main_activities.description: Students receive information about digital journalism through auditory modality
Students practice language related to digital journalism using auditory approach
Students produce original content about digital journalism demonstrating advanced thinking

discussion_prompts: What are the implications of digital journalism for society?
How would you design a better approach to digital journalism?
What criteria would you use to evaluate digital journalism?

vocabulary_support.tier_2: Academic and topic-specific words for digital journalism
vocabulary_support.tier_3: Domain-specific technical terms related to digital journalism

homework_options.required: Core assignment at advanced level using auditory approach

teacher_notes.grouping_suggestions: Flexible grouping based on readiness and interest
teacher_notes.time_management: Build in flexibility for different pacing needs

common_difficulties: Students may lack background knowledge about digital journalism
Vocabulary may be challenging for some students
Some students may need more processing time
methodology: UDL + Differentiated Instruction + CLT + Multiple Intelligences
references: CAST Universal Design for Learning Guidelines
